tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE backups (
    backup_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    backup_name VARCHAR(255),
    backup_date DATE,
    backup_path VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE BackupSettings (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    backup_location STRING,
    backup_frequency STRING,
    last_backup_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE BackupLogs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    backup_id INT,
    backup_date DATE,
    backup_status STRING
)

CREATE TABLE BackupHistory (
    history_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    backup_id INT,
    backup_date DATE,
    backup_size INT
)

CREATE TABLE BackupErrors (
    error_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    backup_id INT,
    error_code INT,
    error_description STRING
)

CREATE TABLE backups (
    backup_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    backup_name VARCHAR(255),
    backup_description TEXT,
    backup_date TIMESTAMP,
    backup_status VARCHAR(50)
)

CREATE TABLE backup_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    backup_id INT,
    backup_date TIMESTAMP,
    log_details TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE backup_schedule (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    schedule_name VARCHAR(100),
    backup_frequency VARCHAR(50),
    last_backup_date TIMESTAMP
)

CREATE TABLE backup_configuration (
    config_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    backup_storage VARCHAR(100),
    retention_period INT,
    notification_email VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE backup_users (
    user_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50),
    email VARCHAR(255),
    access_level VARCHAR(20)
)
